title: How could I be a writer? - Quora

response.answer_text: Anyone can be a writer. And its never too late to start working on it. Sequential tips may help you get a better idea about how easy it is to write: Know what you need to write for. If your answer is I can write about anything, then my friend you are taking a wrong step. It is very important to jot down what exactly are you going to write about. Niche content is the start.Know why are you writing. If you don't know your intent about why you are writing, things will go haywire. Answers to your why will help you produce content that is worth ready.For whom you are writing? Find your audience and be specific about who all are you targeting by writing. Understand their thought process, try to figure out what kind of information are they interested in reading and boom! you have the right picture about your content in front of you.Read more than you can write. Reading helps you find different sides of the dice and all you need to do is join the dots and write what you understand the best or what crux you get from the different sources you read.Outlines or in simple layman language framework is the next step for your writing. Segregate your work in different parts and work separately on every part. Make sure all the parts are connected in a sequential manner and the complete work is epitome in perfection.Add your touch to the content. Every individual has that one thing in his writing that makes it unique. Find it and slowly -slowly keep polishing it.“You can always edit a bad page. You can’t edit a blank page.” ― Jodi Picoult

To be a writer you must be an avid reader, read by your whole forth and write things, or stories, try journaling or writing, the physical act of writing drives the grooves deeper. For more help, read this article_: How to be a Writer?
